24   | extern SCREEN _cursvar;
25   | 
26   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------
27   |    FUNCTION: setup_menu()
28   |     PURPOSE: Setup a menu item
29   |  DESRIPTION: This way a menu can be defined as an auto variable
30   |              within a function. The variables are in the same order
31   |              as in the WINDOW type definition
32   |     RETURNS: nothing
33   |     VERSION: 920117 V0.1 - Initial version
34   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------*/
35   | void setup_menu(MENU *menu, int i, char *header, int hotkey, void *function,
36   |                 char *help, void *data, char *format, int flags)
37   | {
38   |   menu[i].header   = header;
39   |   menu[i].hotkey   = hotkey;
40   |   menu[i].function = function;
41   |   menu[i].help     = help;
42   |   menu[i].data     = data;
43   |   menu[i].format   = format;
44   |   menu[i].flags    = flags;
45   | }
46   | 
47   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
48   |    FUNCTION: init_menu()
49   |     PURPOSE: Initialze a menu structure
50   |  DESRIPTION: -
51   |     RETURNS: nothing
52   |     VERSION: 910901 V0.1 - Initial version
53   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
54   | void init_menu(MENU *menu,  /* Pointer to menu structure to initialize */
55   |                int n)       /* Number of menu items to initialize      */
56   | {
57   |   int i;
58   | 
59   |   for (i=0 ; i<n ; i++)
60   |   {
61   |     menu[i].function = NULL;
62   |     menu[i].format = "";
63   |     menu[i].hotkey = -1;
64   |     menu[i].header = "";
65   |     menu[i].help = "";
66   |     menu[i].flags = 0;
67   |     menu[i].data  = NULL;
68   |   }
69   | }
70   | 
71   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
72   |    FUNCTION: set_display_colors()
73   |     PURPOSE: Set display colors for COLOR or MONO monitor
74   |  DESRIPTION: Sets the global variables according to monitor type
75   |              defined. This can be MONO or COLOR.
76   |     RETURNS: nothing
77   |     VERSION: 911126 V0.1 - Initial version
78   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
79   | void set_display_colors(int mode)
80   | {
81   |   switch(mode)
82   |   {
83   |     case MONO:
84   |       display_mode = MONO;
85   |       strcpy(display_mode_str,"MONO");
86   |       _menu_att       = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* memu item        */
87   |       _menu_hotkey    = (16*BLACK+INTENSE_WHITE) & 0x7F;  /* hotkey of item   */
88   |       _menu_highlight = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;          /* highlighted item */
89   |       _window_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* window attribute */
90   |       _border_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* border           */
91   |       _error_att      = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* Error window     */
92   |       _disabled_att   = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* DISABLED item    */
93   |       _comment_att    = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* COMMENT item     */
94   |       _dialog_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* Dialog menu      */
95   |       _desktop_att    = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;          /* Desktop attrib   */
96   |       break;
97   | 
98   |     default:
99   |       display_mode = COLOR;
100  |       strcpy(display_mode_str,"COLOR");
101  |       _menu_att       = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;      /* memu item        */
102  |       _menu_hotkey    = (16*WHITE+RED)   & 0x7F;      /* hotkey of item   */
103  |       _menu_highlight = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;      /* highlighted item */
104  |       _window_att     = (16*BLACK+WHITE) & 0x7F;      /* window attribute */
105  |       _border_att     = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;      /* border           */
106  |       _error_att      = (16*RED+YELLOW)  & 0x7F;      /* Error window     */
107  |       _disabled_att   = (16*WHITE+RED)   & 0x7F;      /* DISABLED item    */
108  |       _comment_att    = (16*WHITE+BLUE)  & 0x7F;      /* COMMENT item     */
109  |       _dialog_att     = (16*WHITE+BLACK) & 0x7F;      /* Dialog menu      */
110  |       _desktop_att    = (16*BLUE+YELLOW) & 0x7F;      /* Desktop attr     */
111  |       break;
112  |   }
113  | }
114  | 
115  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
116  |     FUNCTION: clrscr()
117  |      PURPOSE: clear screen
118  |  DESCRIPTION: This function is only to be used with MSC.
119  |               This is a standard function in TC. We will clear the
120  |               entire screen by filling a 'window' with spaces with
121  |               BLACK background and WHITE foreground.
122  |      RETURNS: Nothing
123  |      HISTORY: 910901 V0.1 - Initial version
124  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
125  | #ifdef __MSC__
126  | void clrscr()
127  | {
128  |   v_fillarea(0,0,_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines,' ',_desktop_att);
129  | }
130  | #endif
131  | 
132  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
133  |     FUNCTION: printcenter()
134  |      PURPOSE: Print a string centered around (row,col).
135  |  DESCRIPTION: Calculates center and calls v_prints()
136  |      RETURNS: nothing
137  |      HISTORY: 910710 V0.1 - Initial version
138  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
139  | void printcenter(int row,int col, char *string)
140  | {
141  |   v_prints(row, col - (strlen(string) >> 1), string);
142  | }
143  | 
144  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
145  |     FUNCTION: printhotcenter()
146  |      PURPOSE: Print a hotstring centered around (row,col)
147  |  DESCRIPTION: Calculates center and calls hotstring() with no
148  |               hotkey (i.e. -1)
149  |      RETURNS: nothing
150  |      HISTORY: 911219 V0.1 - Initial version
151  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
152  | void printhotcenter(int row,int col, char *string, int str_att)
153  | {
154  |   hotstring(row, col - (strlen(string) >> 1), -1, string, str_att);
155  | }
156  | 
157  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
158  |     FUNCTION: hotstring()
159  |      PURPOSE: print a string with the 'hotkey' set
160  |  DESCRIPTION: Print the string on the screen, set the attribute of
161  |               the entire string and set the attribute of the 'hotkey'
162  |      RETURNS: nothing
163  |      HISTORY: 920213 V0.1
164  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
165  | void hotstring(int row, int col, int hotkey, char *string, int str_att)
166  | {
167  |   wn_log("hotstring() (%d,%d), hotkey='%d' <%s>\n",row,col,hotkey,string);
168  |   v_prints(row,col,string);
169  |   v_setattrib_area(row,col,strlen(string),1,str_att);
170  |   if (hotkey > -1)
171  |     v_setattrib(row,col+hotkey,_menu_hotkey);
172  | }
173  | 
174  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
175  |     FUNCTION: edit()
176  |      PURPOSE: Edit data with editstr()
177  |  DESCRIPTION: -
178  |      RETURNS: nothing
179  |      HISTORY: 910829 V0.1 - Initial version
180  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
181  | void edit_data(int row, int col, char *header, char *format, void *data)
182  | {
183  |   char s[80];
184  | 
185  |   void_sprintf(s,format,data);
186  |   editstr(row,col,10,header,s,_DRAW);
187  |   void_sscanf(s,format,data);
188  | }
189  | 
190  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
191  |     FUNCTION: void_sprintf()
192  |      PURPOSE: My own printf() function, including Boolean type
193  |  DESCRIPTION: -
194  |      RETURNS: Pointer to string, in which is printed
195  |      HISTORY: 900624 V0.1 - Initial version
196  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
197  | char *void_sprintf(char *str, char *format, void *data)
198  | {
199  |   char *s;
200  |   int long_format = FALSE;
201  | 
202  |   if (!format) /* || !data) */
203  |     return(NULL);
204  | 
205  |   s = strchr(format,'%'); /* Check for format identifier   */
206  |   if (!s)                 /* If no identifier, return NULL */
207  |     return(NULL);
208  | 
209  |   s = strpbrk(format,"duouxXfegEGcsB");
210  |   if (*(s-1) == 'l')
211  |     long_format = TRUE;
212  | 
213  |   switch (*s)
214  |   {
215  |     case 'd':
216  |     case 'i':
217  |       if (long_format)
218  |         sprintf(str,format, *((long *) data));
219  |       else
220  |         sprintf(str,format, *((unsigned int *) data));
221  |       break;
222  |     case 'o':
223  |     case 'u':
224  |     case 'x':
225  |       sprintf(str,format, *((unsigned int *) data));
226  |       break;
227  |     case 'X':
228  |       if (long_format)
229  |         sprintf(str,format,*((unsigned long *) data));
230  |       else
231  |         sprintf(str,format, *((unsigned int *) data));
232  |       break;
233  |     case 'f':
234  |     case 'e':
235  |     case 'g':
236  |     case 'E':
237  |     case 'G':
238  |       if (long_format)
239  |         sprintf(str,format,*((double *)data));
240  |       else
241  |         sprintf(str,format, *((float *) data));
242  |       break;
243  |     case 'c':
244  |       sprintf(str,format,*(char *)data);
245  |       break;
246  |     case 's':
247  |       sprintf(str,format,(char *) data);
248  |       break;
249  |     case 'B':
250  |       if ((int *)data)
251  |         strcpy(str,"ON");
252  |       else
253  |         strcpy(str,"OFF");
254  |       break;
255  |     default:
256  |       break;
257  |   }
258  | 
259  |   return(str);
260  | }
261  | 
262  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
263  |     FUNCTION: void_sscanf()
264  |      PURPOSE: Scan data from a string, typecasting the void pointer
265  |  DESCRIPTION: -
266  |      RETURNS: nothing
267  |      HISTORY: 900624 V0.1 - Initial version
268  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
269  | void void_sscanf(char *str, char *format, void *data)
270  | {
271  |   char *s;
272  |   char *dummy;
273  |   int long_format = FALSE;
274  | 
275  |   s = strchr(format,'%'); /* Check for format identifier   */
276  |   if (!s)                 /* If no identifier, return NULL */
277  |     return;
278  | 
279  |   if (format == NULL)
280  |     return;
281  | 
282  |   s = strpbrk(format,"duouxXfegEGcsB");
283  |   if (*(s-1) == 'l')
284  |     long_format = TRUE;
285  | 
286  |   switch (*s)
287  |   {
288  |     case 'd':
289  |     case 'i':
290  |       if (long_format)
291  |         *(long *)data = atol(str);
292  |       else
293  |         *(int *)data = atoi(str);
294  |       break;
295  | 
296  |     case 'o':
297  |       *(unsigned int *)data = (unsigned int) strtol(str,&dummy,8);
298  |       break;
299  | 
300  |     case 'O':
301  |       *(long *)data = strtoul(str,&dummy,8);
302  |       break;
303  | 
304  |     case 'u':
305  |       *(unsigned int *)data = (unsigned int) strtoul(str,&dummy,10);
306  |       break;
307  | 
308  |     case 'U':
309  |       *(long *)data = strtoul(str,&dummy,10);
310  |       break;
311  | 
312  |     case 'x':
313  |       *(unsigned int *) data = (unsigned int) strtoul(str,&dummy,16);
314  |       break;
315  | 
316  |     case 'X':
317  |       *(long *) data = strtoul(str,&dummy,16);
318  |       break;
319  | 
320  |     case 'f':
321  |     case 'e':
322  |     case 'g':
323  |     case 'E':
324  |     case 'G':
325  |       if (long_format)
326  |         *(double *)data = atof(str);
327  |       else
328  |         *(float *)data = (float) atof(str);
329  |       break;
330  | 
331  |     case 'c':
332  |       sscanf(str,"%c",(char *)data);
333  |       break;
334  | 
335  |     case 's':
336  |       strcpy((char *)data,str);
337  |       break;
338  | 
339  |     default:
340  |       break;
341  |   }
342  | }
343  | 
344  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
345  |     FUNCTION: disp_status()
346  |      PURPOSE: display a message on line 23
347  |  DESCRIPTION: -
348  |      RETURNS: nothing
349  |      HISTORY: 911106 V0.1 - Initial version
350  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
351  | void disp_status(char *format, ...)
352  | {
353  |   va_list arguments;
354  |   static unsigned int i = 0;
355  |   int len;
356  |   char s[132];
357  | 
358  |   /*------------------------------------
359  |     Generate the string
360  |   -------------------------------------*/
361  |   va_start(arguments,format);
362  |   vsprintf(s,format,arguments);
363  |   va_end(arguments);
364  | 
365  |   /*------------------
366  |     Trim the string
367  |   ------------------*/
368  |   len = strlen(s);
369  |   for (i=len ; i<_cursvar.cols ; i++)
370  |     s[i] = ' ';
371  |   s[_cursvar.cols] = '\0';
372  | 
373  |   /*-----------------------------------
374  |     Print string on bottom of display
375  |   ------------------------------------*/
376  |   v_prints(_cursvar.lines,1,s);
377  | 
378  | }
379  | 
380  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
381  |     FUNCTION: show_time()
382  |      PURPOSE: Display time in upper right corner of display
383  |  DESCRIPTION: -
384  |      RETURNS: nothing
385  |      HISTORY: 920212 V0.1
386  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
387  | void show_time()
388  | {
389  |   char timestr[9];
390  |   time_t     tnow;
391  |   struct tm  *tmnow;
392  | 
393  |   /*--------------------------
394  |   | Get and print actual time
395  |   ---------------------------*/
396  |   time(&tnow);
397  |   tmnow = localtime(&tnow);
398  |   sprintf(timestr,"%02d:%02d:%02d",tmnow->tm_hour,tmnow->tm_min,tmnow->tm_sec);
399  |   v_prints(0,_cursvar.cols-7,timestr);
400  | }
401  |
